members.member:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Initializes a new instance of the MailAttachment class and specify the attachment file path.
Attachment file path on the disk
[Tony] 2005-12-1 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Initializes a new instance of the MailAttachment class and specify the attachment file path and display file name.
Attachment file path on the disk The file name displayed in the mail(For display only).
[Tony] 2005-12-1 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Return or set the attachment encoded content.
Content string
Not recommended to use this property directly, unless you want to encode/decode the attachment use your own method.
[Tony] 2005-12-1 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: M:WindowsApplication2.Povolenia.UpdateRowToDatabase
member.SUMMARY: Checks if there is a row with changes and writes it to the database

members.member:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Mails with two parts which are alternative, generally a text in both plain text and HTML format can be found in the mail body.
[Tony] 2005-12-1 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Mail content type supported by QMailClient library.
After initialize a QMail object, this is the default content type. And a Empty content type is not allowed when sending the mail. It should be set before sending mails.
[Tony] 2005-12-1 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Add an attachment into the collection.
Should be a valid instance of a MailAttachment.
An Argument Exception will be thrown when Item is null or invalid.
[Tony] 2005-12-1 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Return unique ID of a mail.
A long string
This ID is used to get and delete mails from the mail server, it's unique on a certain server.
[Tony] 2005-12-1 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Return or set the in-reply-to information of the mail
A unique mail ID
This field contains a piece of text describing a message you are replying to. Some mail systems can use this information to correlate related pieces of mail. It should be a unique mail ID like "BEE5E5C3FA49A445C23F034F75@abc.com"
[Tony] 2005-12-22 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Convert content type string into MailContentType enumeration.
Content type string in the mail body description. MailContentType enumeration
Used for receiving mails
[Tony] 2005-12-1 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Convert MailContentType enumeration into content type string.
MailContentType enumeration Content type string
Used for sending mails
[Tony] 2005-12-1 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Get content type of an attachment according to the given attachment's file name.
The file name of an attachment Content type string
Used when sending mails
[Tony] 2005-12-1 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Analyze mail body.
Optional. If MailHeader is not given, it will analyze mail header in the body instead, otherwise use the given header information.
Used when receiving mails.
[Tony] 2005-12-1 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Get date time information from date time string in mail header.
Date time string with time zone A DateTime value
In this version, time zone is ignored.
[Tony] 2005-12-1 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Generally used to get string according to the key given in body content or get ascii values in mail header section.
Mail codes Searching key Optional. Indicate whether the string is contains a pair of quotation marks, default is False. Optional. Indicate whether the string is contains a semicolon, default is False. The string required according to the Key
[Tony] 2005-12-1 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Convert text string into Base64 string.
String to convert Charset string Add a [CRLF] after each 76 chars Base64 string
Do not add "=?,?="(Do not add charset information with the string).
[Tony] 2005-12-1 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Decode string from ascii encoding
String to decode Charset string Decoded string
If charset is invalid, the system default charset is used instead
[Tony] 2005-12-1 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Decode the the part of the mail body which is text-based.
Support following Content-Transfer-Encoding method: 7bit, binary, base64, quoted-printable
Unsupported: 8bit
Mail body content Content transfer encoding description Charset description Indicate whether the content contains a sub header which needs to be analyzed, default is False Decoded mail body text
[Tony] 2005-12-1 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Read a mail from a disk file.
Disk file path If true, it only analyze mail header section. This is used to increase performance when there only need to view mail properties, not mail content.
[Tony] 2005-12-1 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Read a mail from a stream, file stream, memory stream or others.
An instance of a stream. If true, it only analyze mail header section. This is used to increase performance when there only need to view mail properties, not mail content.
[Tony] 2005-12-1 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Add custom information in mail header.
Field key Field value
An 'X-' is added automatically to your given Key as the mail header field key.
[Tony] 2005-12-1 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

members.member:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Return or set whether the working socket should wait for some period of time between sending and receving message.
True or False
Set this property to TRUE when you are behide a firewall, using an anti-virus software which scans incoming emails or there is a high network latency. Otherwise, set this property to FALSE, it will increase performance.
[Tony] 2005-12-1 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Retrieve a whole mail from POP3 server.
The unique ID of the mail required to retrieve An instance of the EMail class
The unique ID could be found in the ArrayList returned by GetMailList() method. The GetMailList() returns an ArrayList contains many instances of EMail class and the properties UniqueID of these instances are already set by that method.
[Tony] 2005-12-1 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Retrieve a whole mail from POP3 server.
The unique ID of the mail required to retrieve If True, it will return the whole mail source codes; if False, it will return only the codes of the mail body section. Mail source codes
Use this overload version only when you want to decode the mail using your own method.
[Tony] 2005-12-1 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Delete a mail from the server permanently.
The unique ID of the mail required to delete
An Int16 value, 1 - Successful; 2 - Failed; -1 - No such mail on server(the mail may be already deleted)
[Tony] 2005-12-1 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Retrieve the mail the server and then delete it.
The unique ID of the mail required to retrieve and then delete An instance of EMail class if success, else it will return Nothing(null in C#)
[Tony] 2005-12-1 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Send a POP3 command to the server
Command name Optional. If the command will cause the server to return a large text response, set this to True. Server's response text in bytes array
[Tony] 2005-12-1 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Check the response of the server.
Server's response, it is in bytes array format. Optional. The message of the server's response. True, command execute successful; False, command execute failed.
[Tony] 2005-12-1 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Get mail's unique ID list
Indicate whether to use the UID as the key in the return hashtable A hashtable contains a UID list
If UIDAsKey is True, the UID is the key of the hashtable, otherwise the mail index will be the key.
[Tony] 2005-12-1 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
